intro: Streptocarpus × veitchii, commonly known as the hybrid streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors such as pink, purple, and white. The plant typically has velvety, heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
